flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
My daughter Dejah was keeping track of how many days it would be until she was 18 (So are we! :) She was using pieces of paper taped to the wall, and hash marks. So, for Christmas, I thought I'd make a count-down timer for her that was digital. While making the prototype, I thought "Why just one date?", so I made it handle a bunch of dates. I also made it capable of displaying different time units - so you can see seconds, hours, days, weeks, months and years until or since an event.

Then, after the prototype was built, I attached and embedded the parts into a mirror, so it actually looks reasonably nice!

guide.summary: Using an atMega328, an LCD, and a real time clock, you can make a fun and useable gadget that calculates "how much time until ..." or "how much time since ..." any event you choose.
guide.title: The Dejah View - a customizable event count-down / count-up timer
